alert.note: Alert for Caroline (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 10:50AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Sussex, southwestern Kent and eastern Caroline Counties through 1130 AM EDT... At 1049 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Greensboro to near Sharptown to near Hebron. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Seaford, Denton, Laurel, Harrington, Federalsburg, Bridgeville, Greensboro, Delmar, Goldsboro, Woodside, Viola, Smithville, Agner, Sycamore, Sandtown, Andrewsville, Felton, Blades, Greenwood and Houston. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Warning remains in effect for portions of Caroline and Sussex counties until 1115 AM EDT.
